image.altText: a crowd of people walking on a dirty road, two people carry a stretcher made out of tree branches.

props.synopsis: The International Organisation for Migration's chief of mission in Papua New Guinea said the scale of impact was greater than initially thought.

title.children: UN agency says more than 670 people feared dead after Papua New Guinea landslide

image.altText: A woman's hand holding a tub of CoYo vanilla bean organic coconut yoghurt outdoors in front of a garden

props.synopsis: A Queensland "dairy-free" ice cream and yoghurt company was told its product wasn't suitable to be marketed as "dairy-free" years prior to the anaphylaxis death of a woman in the UK, court documents allege.

title.children: Yoghurt company told product not suitable for 'dairy free' claim before woman's anaphylaxis death, lawsuit claims

image.altText: An illustration of an electric car and a petrol car.

props.synopsis: Whether you drive an electric car or are considering making the switch, you've probably been drawn into a discussion about whether they are really better for the climate. To save you from your next barbecue encounter, we have put two cars to the test.

title.children: Are electric cars really greener than petrol cars? We've lined up two SUVs and put them to the test

image.altText: A composite image of a man in black and white in the foreground, wielding an axe. Behind is a smashed car, red dirt and a ho

props.synopsis: Australia's domestic violence scourge is dominating headlines around the country. But in country towns like this one, harrowing stories of abuse are just another Monday.

title.children: It's a Monday morning in an outback courthouse and 73 people are waiting outside

image.altText: A man sitting at a desk turns slightly to look at the camera, with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: After a decade of working in Britain's besieged NHS, Harshal Deshmukh had had enough. So he headed to Queensland and hasn't looked back.

title.children: British doctor leaving UK for better lifestyle triples his salary in Australia

image.altText: A graphic design of a document with redacted sections and words highlighted, including "very racist" and "upsetting".

props.synopsis: It was billed as a "really impactful" look at Victoria Police's response to youth gangs. In the aftermath, attendees complained they should have been warned they would see "someone get stabbed to death".

title.children: 'Explicit videos and even CCTV footage of a murder': Inside police seminar that left public servants 'disturbed'

image.altText: Kylie Kwong sits at a table in an empty restaurant. She wears all black, thick-rimmed glasses and hand is on her chin

props.synopsis: Kylie Kwong has been at the top of the Australian food scene for three decades. Now, she reveals her surprising next chapter as she continues to channel unimaginable grief into a force for good.

title.children: Kylie Kwong worked 'like a maniac' to process her tsunami of grief. Her son's spirit has sparked a life-changing shift

image.altText: People work at desks in an airy room, sitting in front of computers.

props.synopsis: After years of issues and commentators calling for reform, the findings from a parliamentary inquiry into the corporate regulator ASIC are expected next month — with signs that significant changes could be on their way.

title.children: Soft deals with banks and inaction after tip-offs — brand ASIC needs a change

image.altText: A digitally edited graphic of an older woman, a middle-aged man and two young women over a light blue semi-circle.

props.synopsis: Baby Boomers who used telex machines in their first jobs are working alongside Generation Z colleagues who have always had a smartphone. With more of us living — and working — for longer, how are we making it work?

title.children: Four generations, one office: How the modern-day workplace is embracing Boomers and Zoomers

image.altText: photo of woman standing with a serious look on her face

props.synopsis: There is a small sign in Western Victoria — one of 15 locations around the country, from creeks and waterholes to bores and mountains — that is a racist slur in plain sight.

title.children: More than a dozen locations bear this racist term and relic of colonial oppression

image.altText: A defaced electoral sign.

props.synopsis: In the first Reconciliation Week since the defeat of the Voice to Parliament, the inability of our national discourse to reflect on its significance is stunning. It is, again, Indigenous people who have quietly been doing the heavy lifting on what should come next.

title.children: Since the Voice to Parliament's defeat, has the Great Australian Silence been extended into perpetuity?

image.altText: A person boarding a bus in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Bus, train, ferry and light rail fares will be dramatically reduced as the Queensland government hopes to "give people a reason to get back to public transport".

title.children: Prices slashed to 50 cents in 'radical change' to how much Queenslanders pay for public transport

image.altText: GHB soy sauce fish

props.synopsis: Just 1 millilitre too much can trigger an overdose. We went to a music festival to learn how the "blowouts" hitting Australian hospitals start.

title.children: More emergencies than heroin, more arrests than cocaine. Why haven't you heard of this drug?

image.altText: A painting of six prehistoric mammal like creatures that look like strange furry platypus of different sizes

props.synopsis: The "echidnapus" is one of the newly described ancient monotremes from a fossil hotspot in NSW that could give us more clues about an era when egg-laying mammals diversified.

title.children: 'This was like a bonanza': What Tim Flannery's discovery in a museum drawer could tell us about Australia's monotremes

image.altText: A mother and daughter named Jennifer and Gretl Petelczyc smiling happily in a photo.

props.synopsis: WA Premier Roger Cook describes the murder of a Perth mother and daughter, shot dead in their own home on Friday by a 63-year-old man, as "chilling and horrific".

title.children: Mother and daughter remembered as 'beautiful people' as premier condemns 'chilling' murders

image.altText: Composite image of Cam McInnies, Latrell Mitchell and Lehi Hopoate

props.synopsis: Two hip-drop tackles receive different punishments, the ladder leaders get belted by the premiers, and a famous name at Brookvale Oval shines again. Here's this week's NRL Round-Up.

title.children: NRL Round-Up: Sin-bin drama confuses Souths, Sharks cop a 42-point reality check, and another Hopoate shines at Brookvale

image.altText: Leaning on a wooden fence post, an older man in a faded brown hat stars in the direction of cattle on arid, yellowed grass.

props.synopsis: King Island, off Tasmania's north-west tip, usually produces more than 20 per cent of the state's beef, but the worst drought on record is forcing farmers to make heartbreaking decisions.

title.children: Seepless nights, cracked dams and cows eating seaweed mark King Island's worst drought on record

image.altText: Smoke in the sky can be seen after rockets were fired.

props.synopsis: Warning sirens are heard in Tel Aviv for the first time in four months after the armed wing of Hamas launched a barrage of rockets into Israel.

title.children: Hamas launches rockets towards Tel Aviv for the first time in months

image.altText: A blonde woman in scrubs looks at herself in a mirror.

props.synopsis: Breast implant removal was once a rare procedure but it is becoming more common in Australia. Some women are getting rid of them for good over concerns they could be making them sick.

title.children: Cristina thought breast implants would make her look and feel good. They had the opposite effect

image.altText: Women holding babies shelter under a tin roof as it rains.

props.synopsis: Schools are closed and volunteers deployed to the region as Cyclone Remal bears down on Bangladesh's southern coast, with gales and gusts of up to 130 kilometres per hour expected.

title.children: At least 800,000 people evacuated in Bangladesh ahead of Cyclone Remal's landfall

image.altText: An aerial photo of a coal power plant surrounded by Australian bush.

props.synopsis: It passed largely unnoticed, but a NSW energy market meltdown has sparked warnings the energy transition is veering off the road.

title.children: Warnings Australia's energy transition 'out of control' as NSW market quietly melts down

image.altText: Light plane lands at Bankstown Airport

props.synopsis: Aerial footage shows the aircraft flying right above suburban houses before it lands and skids across a taxiway, tipping onto its wing on the grass.

title.children: Light plane appears to only just make Sydney runway as it narrowly avoids trees and rooftops

image.altText: A soldier in camouflage and a backpack with the Union Jack has their back to the camera, green hills in the background

props.synopsis: Under the proposed plan, which would come into effect if Mr Sunak's Conservative Party wins July's UK general election, 18-year-olds would either join the military full-time for a year or volunteer one weekend a month in community services.

title.children: British PM Rishi Sunak announces plan to bring back mandatory national service

image.altText: Wrecked F1 car lifted in the air after a crash

props.synopsis: Charles Leclerc has beaten Australian Oscar Piastri to win the Monaco Grand Prix for the first time.

title.children: Leclerc makes history to win Monaco Grand Prix after 'monster of an accident' stops race

image.altText: A burned out small bicycle among rubble with yellow police tape in front.

props.synopsis: Six other babies were rescued and taken to another hospital where they remain in a critical condition. It's the second deadly blaze in India this weekend.

title.children: Six infants die in India after fire broke out in children's hospital

image.altText: Josh Rachele celebrates an Adelaide Crows AFL goal.

props.synopsis: West Coast is left embarrassed after being handed a 99-point thrashing by Adelaide, while Melbourne and Hawthorn enjoy their respective victories.

title.children: Crows put on a clinic against Eagles as Demons, Hawks celebrate wins

image.altText: A man smiles while standing next to cartoon mascots of two mice.

props.synopsis: Richard Sherman, the writer behind songs in classic Disney movies such as Mary Poppins and The Jungle Book has died at the age of 95, the film and entertainment company said.

title.children: 'Grateful for the mark he left on the world': Songwriter behind famous Disney hits dies at the age of 95

image.altText: Cascading rooftops in a brand new housing development in Alkimos, Western Australia.

props.synopsis: Australia is good at producing things, but it has excelled at producing vested interest groups that control key sectors of the economy.

title.children: Vested interest groups putting themselves before Australia is a time-honoured tragedy

image.altText: A man laying in a hospital bed in a neck brace.

props.synopsis: Australia's top trampolinist Blake Rutherford found out he had a spot on the Olympic team just days after breaking his neck at training. He's drawing inspiration from his hometown sporting hero Anna Meares.

title.children: Why 'crushed' sporting star is determined to bounce back from Olympics heartbreak

image.altText: An older man in a cap stands in a paddock and holds out a boll of cotton, which has a spider crawling on it.

props.synopsis: Once devoid of insect life, Australian cotton paddocks are now teeming with spiders and other animals as the cotton industry moves further away from pesticide use.

title.children: Spiders and frogs return to cotton farms as industry cleans up its act

image.altText: A blury picture of a screen showing smoke rising from a building

props.synopsis: Sixteen people are confirmed dead and dozens have been injured after a hardware store was struck.

title.children: CCTV footage captures moment a Russian strike hit Ukrainian superstore, killing 16

image.altText: Grayson Murray plays a shot

props.synopsis: Grayson Murray, a two-time winner on the PGA Tour, died Saturday morning at age 30, the day after withdrawing from a tournament.

title.children: Two-time PGA Tour winner Grayson Murray dies aged 30

image.altText: A woman in a wedding dress and a man in a tuxedo hanging from a rock above bushland.

props.synopsis: Jade King's story is proof that you can find a romantic match anywhere — even in a car park after abseiling down a mountain.

title.children: Abseiling couple takes romance to the next level with 'perfect' mountain wedding
